greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of partitions of n with k kinds of 1; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: Partial sum operator applied to column k gives column k+1.
A(n,k) is also defined for k < 0. All given formulas and programs can be applied also if k is negative.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
formula: Column k is Euler transform of k,1,1,1,... .
For fixed k>=0, A(n,k) ~ 2^((k-5)/2) * 3^((k-2)/2) * n^((k-3)/2) * exp(Pi*sqrt(2*n/3)) / Pi^(k-1). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 24 2018
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(
b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0 or i<2,
binomial(k+n-1, n), add(b(n-i*j, i-1, k), j=0..n/i))
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n == 0 || i < 2, Binomial[k + n - 1, n], Sum[b[n - i*j, i - 1, k], {j, 0, n/i}]];
Table[A[n, d - n], {d, 0, 14}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 17 2018, translated from 3rd Maple program *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 17 2017
